Class Task

java.lang.Object
taskmanagement.domain.Task
All Implemented Interfaces:
ITask
public class Task extends Object implements ITask
Task entity with immutable identity (id), validated fields, and a behavioral state managed by the TaskState state machine.

Constructors delegate to setters to reuse validation logic. State changes are validated to allow only legal forward transitions, and visitor support is provided via accept(TaskVisitor).

  • Constructor Details

    • Task

      public Task(int id, String title, String description, TaskState state)
      Constructs a task with all fields; setters perform validation.
      Parameters:
      id - task id (non-negative recommended; DAO may assign)
      title - non-empty title
      description - nullable description
      state - non-null state
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if title is blank
      ValidationException - if state is null or transition is illegal

    • Task

      public Task(Task other)
      Copy constructor.
      Parameters:
      other - another task instance to copy (must not be null)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if other is null

    • setId

      public void setId(int id)
      Sets the identifier.

      Negative ids are tolerated only if your DAO uses them as placeholders; otherwise prefer non-negative ids.

      Parameters:
      id - the identifier to set

    • getState

      public TaskState getState()

      Specified by:
      getState in interface ITask
      Returns:
      task state (never null)

    • setState

      public void setState(TaskState newState)
      Sets the state and enforces forward-only transitions.

      Allowed transitions: ToDo → InProgress → Completed. Setting the same state is idempotent. Throws unchecked ValidationException to keep caller APIs simple.

      Parameters:
      newState - the new state (must not be null)
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if newState is null or the transition is illegal

    • transitionTo

      public void transitionTo(TaskState target) throws ValidationException
      Transitions to a target state if allowed by the current state's rules.
      Parameters:
      target - desired target state (must not be null)
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if the transition is not allowed
      NullPointerException - if target is null

    • advanceState

      public void advanceState() throws ValidationException
      Advances to the next state according to the current state's behavior.
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if advancing is not allowed

    • accept

      public void accept(TaskVisitor visitor)
      Accepts a TaskVisitor and dispatches to the record-typed visit based on the current TaskState.
      Specified by:
      accept in interface ITask
      Parameters:
      visitor - the visitor to accept (must not be null)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if visitor or state is null
